result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Todd Depas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse programs.
Concurrent with: All files

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with the victims
Maintain absolute Sobriety
Comply with all DOC rules/pay all supervision fees/successfully complete any program, counseling, evaluations, assessments and treatments s appropriate from the DOC assessment.
Payment of all court obligations, restitution and supervision fees.
Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Assistant District Attorney Joshua Dryak appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Eric Todd Depas appears in custody with attorney Carrie J LaPlant via Zoom. Defendant pleads not guilty to both counts.  Present bond continued  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Eric Todd Depas in court with attorney Carrie J LaPlant and both appear via zoom.  Defendant Eric Todd Depas in custody at the Brown County Jail.  Assistant District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State.
Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Plea negotiations placed on the record. Global Offer
Court accepts waiver and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
